trans-unit.source: title: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10
trans-unit.target: title: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Install Hyper-V on Windows 10

trans-unit.source: 12-Nov update.
trans-unit.target: 12-Nov update.

trans-unit.source: Before you can begin using virtual machines on Windows 10 you will need to enable the Hyper-V role.
trans-unit.target: Before you can begin using virtual machines on Windows 10 you will need to enable the Hyper-V role.

trans-unit.source: This can be done using the Windows 10 graphical user interface, PowerShell or DISM.
trans-unit.target: This can be done using the Windows 10 graphical user interface, PowerShell or DISM.

trans-unit.source: This documents will walk through each of these.
trans-unit.target: This documents will walk through each of these.

trans-unit.source: Enable Hyper-V Through the GUI
trans-unit.target: Enable Hyper-V Through the GUI

trans-unit.source: Right click on the Windows button and select ‘Programs and Features’.
trans-unit.target: Right click on the Windows button and select ‘Programs and Features’.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Turn Windows Features on or off’.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Turn Windows Features on or off’.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Hyper-V’ and click ‘OK’.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Hyper-V’ and click ‘OK’.

trans-unit.source: When the installation has completed you will be prompted to restart your computer.
trans-unit.target: When the installation has completed you will be prompted to restart your computer.

trans-unit.source: Enable Hyper-V with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Enable Hyper-V with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell console as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell console as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following command:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following command:

trans-unit.source: ```Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName Microsoft-Hyper-V –All`
trans-unit.target: ```Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName Microsoft-Hyper-V –All`

trans-unit.source: When the installation has completed you will need to reboot the computer.
trans-unit.target: When the installation has completed you will need to reboot the computer.

trans-unit.source: Enable Hyper-V with DISM.
trans-unit.target: Enable Hyper-V with DISM.

trans-unit.source: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool or DISM is used to service Windows images and prepare Windows Pre installation Evironments.
trans-unit.target: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool or DISM is used to service Windows images and prepare Windows Pre installation Evironments.

trans-unit.source: DISM can also be used to enable Windows features in running instances of the OS.
trans-unit.target: DISM can also be used to enable Windows features in running instances of the OS.

trans-unit.source: To enable the Hyper-V role using DISM:
trans-unit.target: To enable the Hyper-V role using DISM:

trans-unit.source: Open up a PowerShell or CMD session as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open up a PowerShell or CMD session as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command:

trans-unit.source: Once completed you will be prompted to reboot.
trans-unit.target: Once completed you will be prompted to reboot.

trans-unit.source: Next Step
trans-unit.target: Next Step

trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create a virtual switch
